intro: Alchornea megalostylis, commonly known as the large-styled alchornea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, a common feature in the family. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Alchornea megalostylis is adapted to humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed habitats.
